Reviews.Title: “Poor facilities and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Vazquez7
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for what it is. 4 star hotel which has room service that completely closes at 11pm (note that it is an airport hotel). Unfortunately if you need something to eat even ten minutes prior to their time of closure of service (room service that is) this may not be possible either. Staff currently are below standard- leaving you on hold for ten minutes or longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for travellers”
Reviews.Author: Glow_wormnz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of the reasonable price and because of the complimentary shuttle that goes to and from the airport (major hub for trains and planes).. The bus into town only cost 2 euros and was about two minutes walk from hotel (or more if like me you go in the wrong direction). I went to Amsterdam to visit Keukenhof and I found that the best way to get there was to take shuttle back to airport and get the bus that goes directly there (bus was included as part of the package with my Keukenhof ticket).. The bar was a lovely place to sit while I waited for check-in time and nobody had a problem understanding my kiwi accent..

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: wereldburgerAlkmaar
Reviews.Content: I live about 70 kilometers from the airport and had a very early flight to catch. That's why I decided to book a room the night before. To the airport it is a 10 minute drive (if no trafficjam). It is a businesshotel in the close to the highway. Boring surroundings - but efficient. The rooms are ok, clean but nothing special. Only go there for businesstrips or if you have to catch a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Liked my stay here”
Reviews.Author: JamesRamyaRajan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during IBC 2011. The hotel was good was just 15 minutes driving distance from RAI and the shuttle service provided was very helpful. The hotel offer's pickup and drop from the Airport every 30 mins. The rooms were clean and with a double bed, TV, table and chair. I wouldn't call the room spacious, but will be enough for a business traveler or an overnight air travel layover. The food was good. The breakfast buffet, which was included in my stay, was elaborate. The lunch and dinner from the Ã  la carte menu were good as well. The bar too was well stocked. The only negative would be that if you are travelling for pleasure or as a tourist, then coming back late in the night and reaching the central locations from the hotel would require cab.

Reviews.Title: “great for overnight stopover”
Reviews.Author: oregoncowgirl63
Reviews.Content: On previous trips to France, we had to get up at 3AM to get connecting flight inMarseilles to Amsterdam to Portland, Oregon. The last trip, we flew out of Marseilles in the early evening, arrived in Amsterdam about 7pm. Checked into the Mercure a little after 8- had a very comfortable & well equipped room, got a great night's sleep and were ready for our flight back to USA the next morning. It is important to know your room is only for 12 or 13 hours (check in after 8PM, out by 9AM). The plus is that you are already in the airport, so checked bags can stay checked. Staff is efficient and helpful. Food and beverages are available in the airport. Rooms are soundproof & air conditioned. Not elegant, but certainly comfortable & practical. Rooms book up quickly & must be paid in advance. We are planning to stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off”
Reviews.Author: andreunz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a website. Unfortunately, due to some unwanted circumstances, I could not go there anymore. I let the hotel know with 6 days in advance, so that they and myself could not incurr any costs, and could have the chance to sell the room straight away. I got a message from the Hotel saying they would notifiy the reception (I assume so it was easy for them to resell the room to someone else) At the end they resold my room to another guest and charged me 79 EUROS. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “standart hotel out of the city”
Reviews.Author: msaylan
Reviews.Content: Standart rooms, in a quite place out of the city. It is near of a lake where you can do long walks. The food in the breakfast is mediocre but good place for business purposes. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convienant stopover”
Reviews.Author: alexonboard
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a one night stopover in Amsterdam. Free shuttle from hotel to airport, cute bar/restaurant and comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Free shuttle to and from the airport - a big Bonus, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Neha11111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. The rooms were clean and fully equipped. Wifi is available but is not free. It costed us Euro 5-6 for the time we stayed at the hotel. Not bad at all. The front office desk is very helpful and also permitted us for an early check-in. The shuttle drivers were equally nice and informative. Travelling to the Schipol Airport was made extremely easy by the free hotel shuttle. Although, be aware that a trip to the Central Station (center of Amsterdam) will cost you 7 Euro's and is not covered in the GVB daily pass. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and we had a pleasant time staying at Mercure Amsterdam. We would love to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suds123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night, because it being closer to Airport. The interiors needs refurbishment. The room was smelly. The lift was small considering the size of the hotel. We always took the stairs. Free use of computer/internet in the reception. We ate outside so can't comment on the hotel restaurant. The hottle shuttle service was good and on time. Though far from the City Centre, the hotel has two buses on diffrent routes connecting to City Centre.

Reviews.Title: “KLM Delay- Free Night”
Reviews.Author: misodiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly out of the way, and the shuttle runs every half hour to/from airport. It's about a 15 min ride from the airport. Since KLM put us up here, I'm not sure what the rates are. But it was a very 70s style building that looked to have been rennovated. The common area was stylish and the bedrooms seemed to have been redone as well. Sort of a 70s retro style design. Dinner and breakfast were both buffets and no menus were available. Not sure if that is how it is always done. I absolutely loved the food though, and got plenty to eat. If you do buy drinks in the bar it was expensive 3 euro for a small coke bottle. The room a/c didn't seem to be working that well, we opened the window and were comfortable even in Aug. There is also a smallish in-room mini-bar. Tolietries were a conditioning shampoo, shower gel, and bar soap. There was a pants press and a TV with some international channels. Bed was pretty comfortable, not the best, but not awful. We really enjoyed our stay, and loved watching the bunnies eating out the back window. very pretty area, but not near anything if you are looking to sight see. If you had a car I imagine it would be good. And if just staying to get to the airport, just fine.

Reviews.Title: “good friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: colinwilcox1
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband enjoyed a three night stay at this hotel. We were part of a coach trip with others. We arrived about ten thirty in the evening so we were very tired, but the reception staff had us checked in very quickly and we were in our room within minutes. The bed was very comfortable and the room fine for what we needed. It was clean and although a little small we had no complaints. The breakfast was very good with lots of choices from bacon eggs beans to ham cheese to yogurts and cereals and fruits. Coffee was on the table although on our last morning there was non due to the machine being broken I dont know why water could not be boiled but that was the reason for non that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Unremarkable. But acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: MajorVoid
Reviews.Content: Not really sure this can be described as a four star property - it's a basic novotel-style hotel, dating from the late 70s/80s and has had some refurbishment, but perhaps needs a bit more, particularly the beds. It feels more 2 to 3 star than 4 star. The lobby areas seem nicer than the rooms. Can't say I had a particularly comfortable night's sleep - but rates are cheap and I'm sure it's an adequate alternative to the various other airport stopover places. Staff were courteous and friendly. Breakfast was plentiful and again, fine, but nothing exceptional. There is a shuttle bus every half hour between the airport and the hotel but it only seats around 8 passengers - so in the morning when there's a rush for early flights it's pot luck whether you get on or not - I ended up paying 25 euros for a taxi for the 10 minute journey to the terminal. I suspect there may be better choices.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed because in spite of the fact that we have already paid the reservation before by card,at the reception they retained from the card a money guarantee that it isn't unlocked till now ( a week after).

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night before a flight”
Reviews.Author: Africa_Travels
Reviews.Content: Had an early flight out of Amsterdam and wanted to stay close to the airport. The hotel is 5 min from the airport so the location is perfect and the price seemed ok. Check in area, bar and restaurant are all quite new and nice with a pretty terrace overlooking a pond. There is a distinct shortage of lifts, which seem to have been build in as an afterthought. The rooms are smallish, but clean and well appointed. Shower is pretty low and cramped. Arrived around 11pm and was looking for some food, but the choice was pretty terrible. Frozen Pizza of the worst kind. Breakfast was also pretty grim with low quality buffet. Certainly well below the standard of the rest of the hotel. All staff interactions were quite friendly and professional. All in all I was looking for a decent sleep before a flight and the hotel delivered that. If the food can be improved it would even be an ok hotel as a base for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel Opposite Strange Park”
Reviews.Author: Qld_Aussie_Expat_
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Amsterdam Airport is in a good location if you need to get to flights quickly, also it doesn't take long to get into the city by bus. There is a free hotel shuttle that will do pickups and drop offs from the hotel. The rooms are generous and clean. Bathroom is a good size. Rooms are equipped with bar fridge, safe, free WIFI & coffee & tea facilities. A free ice machine on ground floor was also a welcome find. Only negative is I don't think air conditioners in rooms work. We heard other guests complain about this. The bar area and dining area are very relaxing areas. Also there is a lovely outside dining area looking over a pond. A small fitness centre has just been added. The hotel is opposite a large park, garden and lake recreational area. This area makes a very pleasant area for a walk or bike ride. However there seems to be a lot of men going in and out of the park, into the bush off the pathways, and stopping in car park in front of park. We did a big walk around the lake but have to say these strange happenings did not interfere with us. TIP: There is a bus stop 150mtrs south of hotel, goes to airport one way and into city other way. The bus is number 197. Buy a day pass it is cheaper. Also when you book ask for room overlooking park and hotel pond as the viewing of the rabbits in the hotel ground is amazing also the comings and goings in the park across from the hotel. Would be happy to recommend this hotel for stop-over.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place ever ... dirty and over expensive”
Reviews.Author: raffaeu
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot, and this is the premise. We are member of the Sofitel group so we usually travel around the world using Sofitel, Ibis or Mercure. We travel most around Europe and US and we travel at least 3 times a year. This hotel is simply poor and horrible. The rooms are ridiculous small, dirty and the service is absolutely invisible. The receptionist speaks a very bad and poor English and the location is far away from the Airport and from the city. You can catch a bus at 5 minutes walking from the Hotel. What we absolutely didn't like was the price, this is a 2 stars hotel and it shouldn't be more than 50 EUROS at day due to the distance and dirtiness of the place. It advertise free internet and free parking but you have to pay both. The internet was fake, absolutely slow and very expensive. The place looks like an hold jail remodeled to be an hotel. Simply ridiculous ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with quiet surrounding and near the airport”
Reviews.Author: LimPheng
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel near the airport because we arrived late in the evening in Amsterdam and flying off early in the morning after 3 nights... The hotel was decent with nice and fairly spacious room... There is free shuttle bus every 30 mins from 6.30am to 11.30pm to and from the airport and it only takes 10 mins or less. The public transportation to the city is quite convenient and you could take either a bus (197) directly to town, or combination of bus and train (195 bus and metro Laylaan station and change train).... The combination of bus and train takes longer (about 45 mins to 1 hour) but we enjoyed the journey along the way especially the bus ride going through the quiet and beautiful residential areas near the hotel.... Over all we thought this is a good hotel to be based especially if you're flying in late and/or flying out early.... However, do take note that there is nothing much around the hotel within walking distance (other than a small convenient store by the gas station) since it's a standalone building in a greenery area...

Reviews.Title: “Easy access from the Schipol airport”
Reviews.Author: Ninav_fin
Reviews.Content: Very easy to move on from the airport to the hotel; you just hop in a waiting car. Nice and easy for a long weekend holidaymakers like we were. Hotel itself was ok. Nothing very fancy, but clean, quiet and with good breakfast. The area itself did not improve - not at all. But if you are on your way to next flight, wanting to stay for a night or so only, or you have the attitude we had, it is brilliant. We didn`t want to pay too much for the hotel, yet wanted to have nice room. We had a junior suite. It was perfect choise for want we needed. Hotel is in the middle of nowhere, but if you take a taxi or very quick bus to the centre of Amsterdam, this hotel is actually very good choise. There is absolutely nothing to do in the hotel, but we only stayed at the hotel for the nights. Bus goes only 15 (or so) minutes to the centre. I would come back, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and near airport”
Reviews.Author: wazaruha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and near to the airport . Very friendly staff especially the lady at the breakfast restaurant . Shuttle bus provided , easy to access to the schipol aiport and amsterdam central station

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: MuddyBath
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice rooms, quiet, a shuttle bus to the airport. Good value for money. Didn't eat at the restaurant, but looked ok. First time I've had to pay local taxes having prepaid, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay near Schiphol Airport”
Reviews.Author: biztrav123
Reviews.Content: Bus from the main arrivals area from Schiphol at regular intervals or a 20Euro taxi ride This is the second time I have stayed at the hotel and I find the desk staff to be very courteous and efficient. I think the hotel is starting to show its age a bit, but the rooms are clean, well maintained, spotless linens, comfortable bedding, etc. There is not much in the surrounding area and I was warned by my local colleagues not to go walking in the general area of the hotel. However, there is a gas station/convenience store right next door for drinks, snacks, etc. Take the shuttle back to the airport for mass transit into Amsterdam itself. Restaurant serves a very nice dinner (had the beef satay this time around..it was great) and breakfast is good as well, though as in most hotels, no bargain. Will definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a poor and old hotel. The rooms are ugly and dirty. It's impossible that the classification of this hotel is correct... This isn't a 4 star hotel. Maybe 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Bbudel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good stay, great breakfast, WiFi was a bit useless but apart from that was good

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for short break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: denpop
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a deal for New Year in Amsterdam and, given it was an airport hotel, I had some reservations as to how it would be as a base to explore the city. I need not have worried. The hotel was not ACTUALLY at the airport and we could hear no aircraft or traffic noise at all. I also wondered how easy it would be to get into the city. That too was fine. We caught the bus close to the hotel which always ran exactly to time. The only thing lacking was tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The continental breakfast was excellent with masses of choice from a buffet style service.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ambervincent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when my flight was cancelled. Restaurant was good but a bit pricey. Rooms were very good too. We took full advantage of the free shuttle bus running very 30mins to the airport due to there being no shops etc nearby, however you can get everything from the airport. Needs clear signs to the lift as it seems almost hidden, also a larger lift might be a good suggestion. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel clos eto the airport with good service and treament. Also the bar and restaurant was fine. Only negative is the surrondings, there is no ATM mashine, no shop and so on. You have to go to the airport by the shuttlebus, it works.

Reviews.Title: “Spaceful, close to airport but problems in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: geiko_2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in between flights, from Tokyo to Sao Paulo. It is a very convenient hotel if you are in transit, like me. There is a courtesy shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel and vice versa, which runs every 30 minutes, so really a great deal. The rooms are very spacious, but the standard one did not have slippers neither a bath robe. The bathroom had some issues in the sink and bath tub, and the water did not run down properly. However, once I reported this problem at the reception they were keen on fixing it promptly. This hotel is highly recommended if you do not intend to sightsee in central Amsterdam for more than a day, as it is literally in the middle of nowhere (there are buses to the city centre nearby and it takes about 15 to 20 minutes to get there).

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller_UA
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel with a very comfortable business area.

Reviews.Title: “There are better alternatives out there”
Reviews.Author: bunee
Reviews.Content: Check in was great. The guy was very nice and helpful. Got to the room and (as I always do), checked the mini bar for missing ingredients. Found a half used tin of cat food!!! Dropped it to the front desk then rang mini bar to restock the fridge. The guy came to my room saying he had personally checked my bar and there was nothing missing. I then asked him if it was usual to leave cat food and then he said "it must have been the other guests that put something in there after I checked"... Yeah, yeah. Was a 20 min bus ride to the city - not bad. Bed was hard and room was average size. Very thin walls as we got in late and friends in the next room heard us arrive later that night. Ok if you want to stay near the airport (and great receptionist), but otherwise there are better alternatives out there. Plus you have to pay for wi-fi here.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While an airport hotel, the staff was very generous in suggesting going downtown on the public transportation system. Taking the bus to a principal Square was easy and very fast, such that you didn't need to hail a Taxi. The room was more than adequate and we were on a shoulder season and while it was cold outside, it was warm and toasty inside. The shuttle to the Airport was excellent and the driver assisted with all our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good price for value for an airport hotel. The shuttle is not very reliable. i waited 50 min and decided to take a taxi. Good service in the hotel (a 4* service). The bathroom is very simple maybe did not met the 4* standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFOtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Pick Up: Easy Mercure shuttle pick up from Schipol Airport, approx 10-15 mins ride to hotel. Check In/Out: Staff was efficient and friendly. Provided helpful bus direction to downtown. PUBLIC BUS: You can walk outside of the hotel and take a local bus for 2 Euros and it drops you off at Leidseplein Square. The bus ride takes approx 15-20 mins. Good to go in town for a meal or to the Albert Heijn (the supermarket). Note: There are no stores around the hotel, only a gas station. ROOM: As expected from all Mercures, very clean, modern and TV even offered internet radio. In room safe, fridge, and even a trouser press were all standard amenities. VERDICT: Great choice for overnight/transit airport passengers. Not recommended for extended stay due to remote location.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEP QUALITY IS TERRIBLE AND BAD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: amsterdaminsept
Reviews.Content: I DONT RECOMMEND to stay IN THIS HOTEL FOR TOURISTS ,because you will need to take a shuttle to the airport '-then a train and then a tram to see the city,THIS TRANSPORTATION TO THE CITY IS TIME CONSUMING AND TIRING ,SLEEP QUALITY -BAD BAD-hotels bed are terrible AND the walls are very thin ,the cleaning lady in the mornings slams the doors -COULDNT SLEEP!! the STUFF WAS VERY FREINDLY but in amsterdam everyone is! so its not an advantage , they didnt know to recommend on resturants ,THIS HOTEL IS MAYBE GOOD FOR BUSINESS OR FOR SOMEONE WITH NO OTHER CHICE. !

Reviews.Title: “Leverage This Hotel's Unusual Location for Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Low-Budget-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers agree that the staff is great and the rooms are clean and decent, albeit with slightly worn carpeting; I'd argue that the bathrooms are more than decent with a 110v outlet, functional bathtub and hair dryer. For the price-conscious, I found a better rate here than at Accor's lower-tier Ibis and Etap properties when using my company's client code. Those with a car can appreciate the parking options across the road and the proximity to major highways. For the car-less who want a nice room at a good rate, though, there remains the issue of location: halfway between the airport and the city. That's not entirely a bad thing, though. If you're doing business with ACN, IBM, NCR, PWC or others with offices in SW Amsterdam, you're very close. In the summer, youâ€™re steps away from a small beach and a lovely wooded area. Just down the road, you can board a number of suburban bus lines (I don't think they accept the GVB day-card); the trick is to know exactly when they arrive and where they're going. However, if you're willing to walk 15 minutes to the north to Nieuw Sloten, you can access good restaurants, supermarkets and Tram 2 to Vondelpark, Leidesplein and Central Station; check it out on Google Maps, and be sure to walk on the pedestrian/bike path, not the roadway! Youâ€™ll reach many city destinations faster and cheaper this way than by using the airport shuttle and rail service â€“ if youâ€™re dressed for the weather and the walking. But the quickest and most authentic way to roam the city â€“ or nearby countryside -- is by bicycle, and the hotel has a few available for rental. Liability is limited to 100 Euro; two locks are supplied. Follow the bike path to Amsterdam via the Nieuwe Meer locks, a sight in itself. A few other notes: the odd-numbered rooms face a charming quiet pond while the even-numbered rooms face a busy road and rail corridor. There is a lift way down the hallway; rooms offer a free safe and a small refrigerator stocked with pricey beverages and snacks. Various room media options exist either for for free or fee; two free internet terminals (with printer!) in the lobby operate virtually 24 hours. I also appreciated something I've not seen before in my budget travels: a bedside switch for all room lights! In summary, if you can make this hotel's location work for you and your agenda, you'll enjoy your stay and still have money to spend on other things.

Reviews.Title: “Our saviour”
Reviews.Author: Winchcombe
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Amsterdam on our way back from New York to find that all UK airports were closed due to the Icelandic volcano we had to take whatever hotel was offered to us.We definitely struck lucky! At what was obviously a very difficult time for the staff they went out of their way to help us. They put an extra bed into our room to accommodate our son and the shuttle bus just kept going backwards and forwards to the airport so that we were able to keep returning to the airport for updates on the situation. The hotel is in pleasant grounds with a lovely terrace overlooking a small pond. Opposite the hotel is a huge lake with pleasant walks and beach and swimming areas. A bus stops outside for a 3 euro trip to the centre of Amsterdam. The first two nights we ate in the hotel restaurant. The food was very good although the choice was limited. This was explained because they had an unprecidented run on stranded passengers arriving at the hotel. In spite of our uncertain situation we spent a pleasant 4 nights at the Mercure and would like to come back to Amsterdam in more relaxed circumstances and would most likely choose this hotel particularly because of its location as obviously a city centre hotel would be more expensive. We finally managed to escape? by catching the train to the Hook of Holland and caught a ferry to Harwich!

Reviews.Title: “25 Euro by Taxi from the Airport : airport hotel?”
Reviews.Author: hjjv
Reviews.Content: ...arriving late in a cold night, already jetlagged, and having to get up early in the morning: do you wait for the 30 min interval bus? If you do not and take the taxi, it will be 25 Euro ( for ref I had paid some 50 Euro for a taxi ride from La Defense in Paris to CDG) Unhappy with the cost of the ride, you arrive at a Mercure that is not the flagship of the chain. It looks tired. The shuttles to airport run on time but to call this an airport hotel is 'limit'. My business travel agent needs to do more research!

Reviews.Title: “It was a hard trip”
Reviews.Author: saronnolu
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a parking but they request money for day. It was the terrible thing that I faced. But please inform that accross the road there is a FREE parking lot. It is not easy to get city center ,In the weekend shuttle bus hours are very rare. But it can be said it is a clean hotel with great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “No problems, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: VTpikey
Reviews.Content: Perfectly acceptable hotel for a business trip and proximity to airport. Shuttle to airport ran as scheduled. Not a hotel that would be a special part of a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Average comfort close to the Airport, far from everything.”
Reviews.Author: cs1961
Reviews.Content: I've been at this Hotel after a business day in Amsterdam, and I appreciated it mostly because of its proximity to Schiphol Airport: since I had a flight in the morning after my night stay, it has been ok taking advantage of the free shuttle. On the other hand, the position is not amazing at all, facing the Highway and being far from everything else. The building is modern and quite quiet, despite the works they were doing in that period. It has no character and it is very anonymous: a typical resort for business people in hurry. I didn't find a lift. The basicly furnished room was clean, as well as the bathroom. Much better if you have a car (large parking), so you can reach a restaurant different from the one offered by the Hotel. I had not a good experience here: heavy food for too high prices. A very good and rich breakfast compensated my disappointment for the evening dinner. The staff was quite friendly and available to give information. I did appreciated the computer station with free internet connection. It is nice the quiet meadow with a pond in the middle. The check-in was good and fast. The check-out was a bit complicated because of a problem with the voucher released by the travel agency. It depends on personal needs, but I would like better to spend a night in Amsterdam elsewhere (maybe even a three stars hotel), especially if I would travel as a tourist. My answer "yes" to the question below ("would you recommend this hotel to a friend?") is mainly due to the average comfort and it is more addressed to one-night visitors who may be fast leavers from the airport the morning after.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel for preflight overnight...”
Reviews.Author: aversetospam
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fair room at a fair price with proximity to Schiphol airprot, the Mercure will do. The room was small, reasonably clean, with basic furnishings. The lobby had computers with free internet. The hotel bar was not outrageously priced. The hotel is isolated off of a freeway interchange, with shopping limited to a small gas station with convenience store adjacent to the hotel. The shuttle service was free and on time. Staff were cordial. I have used the A4 for this purpose before. I prefer the Mercure for its lower rates and free shuttle in both directions. I prefer the A4 for the size of the rooms and quality of the furnishings. Both the Mercure and the A4 were rather slow on check in. The surge of arrivals off of the incoming shuttles overstrains desk staff and results in long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant modern hotel convienient for Airport”
Reviews.Author: alfie50
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at Schipol when we missed our connecting flight and KLM whose flight had been late were not interested. Cost 75 euros for night. pleasant modern hotel clsoe to airport with free shuttle running every hour. Staff were ok room small but adequate didn't eat in the hotel as it seemed a bit expensive not a lot closeby t the hotel returned on the shuttle to the airport for a meal

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Bateman
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel due to a missed fly in the near of schiphol airport. Got a rate of EUR 99 with the Accor Favorite Guest Card. Hotel is a clean standard hotel with average rooms and free airport shuttle service (about 10-15 min.). Nothing for your holidays but for a short night - everytime again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient - value for money”
Reviews.Author: Allthingshorsey
Reviews.Content: We stopped here whilst attending a show at the RAI conference centre. We used the shuttle bus daily to get to and from Schipol where we caught a train to RAI (4 Euro return). Breakfast was included in the price of 69 Euro and was most adequate - Cereals, fruit, meats, cheese, breads, hot scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns - more than enough variety. The only reason we'd look for another hotel next time was that the shuttle buses last run from Schipol was at 11:45 which meant leaving the show before it ended - we got a taxi from the RAI one night that was 18 Euro - only 2 of us sharing would have obviouslly been more acceptable splitting it 4 ways. A very pleasant hotel and staff - recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Some funny bus trouble”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: This is really quite a nice hotel, its lobby is reasonable. The restaurant / breakfast area was very nice with a great buffet breakfast. For paying 69 EUR for a twin room for 2 nights, we were very pleased. You can buy wireless access. The bar was very swish, although expensive. We did not eat at the hotel, but chose the McDonalds just across the street. Our problem came with the airport bus, which never materialised late one evening, after just missing a bus we waited half an hour - but that bus never arrived, so we waited an hour altogether for a bus. The driver had clearly just been having a break, said something in broken English about "taxis fighting" and we were delayed longer waiting for a hotel employee to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: clean, quiet, good facilities, excellent food & service. very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Mercure for 3 days in April and for 70 Eur per night with breakfast.Breakfast was fro cold to eggs and bacon buffey style and very good. The room was large and clean and the free shuttel to airport and back was great.A taxi was 18 Eur one way and we used shuttel to get to airport and t5hen took the train into Amsterdam each day. Also the held our luggage for 5 days as we did a side trip to Budapest for no charge.Would recomend this Hotel to anyone traveling to Holland and wanting to see Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AseyeCit
Reviews.Content: Do you want a clean, modern hotel room at a reasonable price? You found it! I have stayed in so many hotel rooms this year, and this was by far the nicest. Mine had a huge comfortable bed, a TV with lots of clear channels; a clean and modern bathroom; and very friendly staff. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away!”
Reviews.Author: PaulSonda
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminds me of a Super 8 motel on an Interstate highway in America. It is in the middle of nowhere, with only a McDonalds nearby. To get into town, you need to take a shuttle to the airport, and then take a train downtown. Not recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Amsterdam Airport
HotelInfo.Address: Oude Haagseweg 20, Amsterdam 1066 BW, The Netherlands
